applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the provided document for several key reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the operation of a death benefit pension scheme, not an investment product. The scheme's main and only purpose is explicitly stated as 'to provide benefits for the member's dependants if the member dies before normal retirement age.' 2) While the document is related to a financial product, it is specifically a pure protection product (life insurance) rather than an investment product. The benefits are fixed amounts paid on death and do not have an investment component. 3) The document focuses on defining scheme rules, trustee duties, and benefit calculations rather than product distribution or sales processes. 4) The regulation in question (410) specifically applies to investment products and their target markets, while this document pertains to a protection-only insurance scheme with no investment element. The scheme rules show this is a risk-only product designed to provide death benefits, not an investment vehicle.
regulation_title: Target market and information on products
regulation_text: 410. Where a regulated entity offers, recommends, arranges or provides an investment product, it shall have in place adequate arrangements to - (a) obtain all appropriate information on the investment product and the investment product approval process, including the identified target market of the investment product, and (b) understand the characteristics and identified target market of each investment product. 210 [81]
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
